title: Mobile Crowdsourcing Species Identification Masterclass for Biodiversity Science

context.prior_knowledge: Basic biology knowledge and field research experience
context.additional_context: Corporate in-house biodiversity expert training program conducted in smartphone-based constrained technological environments, emphasizing field-applicable practical skills

learning_goals: Learners can perform a species identification process achieving 90% accuracy for ten unidentified species within 48 hours using a mobile platform.
Learners understand the principles of reputation mechanisms in crowdsourcing systems and can improve their identification accuracy by 20% through peer review processes.
Learners can structure a taxonomic reasoning process into three stages using metadata (location, time, habitat) from observed biological photos.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
